text: Gleb Borisovich Axelrod (; 11 October 1923 in Moscow - 2 October 2003 in Hannover; also spelled Gleb Akselrod) was a Russian pianist. He was a disciple of Grigory Ginzburg. Axelrod won, ex-aequo with Marina Slesaryeva, the II piano edition of the Prague Spring Festival Competition (1951). In 1955 he obtained a 4th prize at the Concours Long-Thibaud, and two years later he placed second at the inaugural Vianna da Motta Competition.
